text: You’re getting ahead of me. These are the organizational roles I think are important to work out/assign before getting into the actual planning of sessions. I understand that this is not what you are really interested in, so feel free to skip this meeting and jump back in when we are getting to the more specific/creative side of things! We’ll likely be getting into defining the contributor role/specific session planning at the next meeting :)

elements.text: You’re getting ahead of me. These are the organizational roles I think are important to work out/assign before getting into the actual planning of sessions. I understand that this is not what you are really interested in, so feel free to skip this meeting and jump back in when we are getting to the more specific/creative side of things! text:
My B. I’m actually interested in the online platforms role!

Our first session will likely be in ~3 weeks, so it might be good to at least do session planning for that this Wednesday. Then whoever is heading the first session will have adequate time to prepare materials, practice, and whatnot.

elements.text: My B. I’m actually interested in the online platforms role!

Our first session will likely be in ~3 weeks, so it might be good to at least do session planning for that this Wednesday. Then whoever is heading the first session will have adequate time to prepare materials, practice, and whatnot.

text: Hmm, I agree that we need to get started on that soon. Still, I feel like we have a lot to discuss on Wednesday already. Maybe we can plan another meeting for that later this week/early next week to talk about the first session

elements.text: Hmm, I agree that we need to get started on that soon. Still, I feel like we have a lot to discuss on Wednesday already. Maybe we can plan another meeting for that later this week/early next week to talk about the first session

text:
<!channel> Okay, so after Wednesday I hope we will have little organizing units that can plan more independently, and meetings with all of us will be needed less frequently, but as the first session will be important for setting a precedent for the rest, I’d like to involve as much of us as have the time and energy for it to bring your inputs, and we should probably try to get working on it soon-ish, as Michael rightly mentioned that it is only about 3 weeks away (though the doodle poll is currently leaning towards Friday’s, giving us some extra days :)) In light of this I propose to plan another meeting for the end of this week/start of next week, but feel free to let me know if it’s becoming too much!

Here’s a doodle poll we can use to find a good time :)
<https://doodle.com/poll/gkn7z7etqaqci3r2>

attachments.title: Doodle: OSSSG - first session planning
attachments.text: Doodle is the simplest way to schedule meetings with clients, colleagues, or friends. Find the best time for one-to-ones and team meetings with our user-friendly calendar tool. Get started today!

elements.text:
Okay, so after Wednesday I hope we will have little organizing units that can plan more independently, and meetings with all of us will be needed less frequently, but as the first session will be important for setting a precedent for the rest, I’d like to involve as much of us as have the time and energy for it to bring your inputs, and we should probably try to get working on it soon-ish, as Michael rightly mentioned that it is only about 3 weeks away (though the doodle poll is currently leaning towards Friday’s, giving us some extra days :)) In light of this I propose to plan another meeting for the end of this week/start of next week, but feel free to let me know if it’s becoming too much!

Here’s a doodle poll we can use to find a good time :)
